definition: to have an accident/to meet with a mishap

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: The easy route is to have a simple password that works everywhere. Unfortunately, this can be a problem.
sentences.chinese: 你可以图方便设置统一的密码，但这么干，准会出事。
出事路段为双向两车道。

sentences.english: Jade wealth understands jade character, heart fear of an accident.
sentences.chinese: 玉财深悉玉万性格，心恐出事。

sentences.english: The old lady knew that something was going to happen, and she was very jumpy .
sentences.chinese: 这老太太知道要出事了，于是吓得心惊肉跳。

sentences.english: The level of radiation decreases dramatically as distance from the site increases.
sentences.chinese: 随着与出事地点之间的距离增加，辐射程度显著降低。

sentences.english: They tell you what happened to this Beaumont fellow?
sentences.chinese: 他们告诉你博蒙特出事了吗？

sentences.english: The accident happened to him at three this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他出事是在今天下午三点半。

sentences.english: Our reporter was the first person on the scene.
sentences.chinese: 的记者是最先到达出事地点的。

sentences.english: He sped his car off the accidental site.
sentences.chinese: 他加快车速驶离了出事地点。

sentences.english: The Japanese aggressors in order to hold their positions, you must ensure WanDing bridge is not an accident.
sentences.chinese: 日寇为了守住阵地，必须要保证畹町桥不出事。

sentences.english: The policemen were dispatched to the spot.
But if you're not smart about it, things can happen.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你不够聪明，就会出事了。

sentences.english: It is thought there are no survivors. Rescue workers are at the scene.
sentences.chinese: 人们认为没有幸存者，救援人员正在出事地点。

sentences.english: Li Danyun reminded yuan Geng backyard total idle to happen.
sentences.chinese: 李淡云提醒元庚后院总闲着要出事的。

sentences.english: I scrabbled beneath the table, having an inkling of what was to come.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉到要出事，于是急忙钻到桌子底下。

sentences.english: Am also the most essential human in me with Che son, will I never allow you to have an accident?
sentences.chinese: 跟澈儿于我也是最重要的人，我决不许你们出事？

definition: to be missing/to disappear/unaccounted for
to dispose of a matter/to be done with it
(of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
safe and sound (idiom)
what?/which?
traffic accident/car crash/CL:場|场[chang2]
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
after the event/in hindsight/in retrospect
to suffer a calamity
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
to go wrong/to get into trouble
